wikipedia_page.main: Walter Hamlet Johnson (21 November 1917 – 12 April 2003) was a British Labour Party politician.

response: Beckett was selected to stand at the 1983 general election as the Labour candidate in the parliamentary constituency of Derby South following the retirement of the sitting MP, Walter Johnson. At the election she retained the seat with a small majority of 421 votes.

Noel-Baker stood down as the MP for Derby South at the 1970 general election, at which he was succeeded by Walter Johnson. His life peerage was announced in the 1977 Silver Jubilee and Birthday Honours and he was raised to the peerage 22 July 1977, as Baron Noel-Baker, of the City of Derby, having declined an appointment as a Companion of Honour in the 1965 New Year Honours. He was president of the International Council of Sport Science and Physical Education from 1960 to 1976.
Walter Johnson (1887–1946) was an American baseball pitcher.
Walter Johnson may also refer to:
*Walter Johnson (politician) (1917–2003), British Labour MP for Derby South from 1970 to 1983
*Walter Johnson (historian) (born 1967), American historian, New York University, and Harvard University
*Walter Johnson (US academic) (1915–1985), American political scientist and historian, University of Chicago
*Walter Johnson High School, in Montgomery County, Maryland, US, named for the baseball player
*Robert Walter Johnson (1899–1971), American physician and tennis coach
